definitions.definition: The act of hauling or dragging.
That which is hauled or dragged.
definitions.example: The pack is a heavy lug.

definitions.definition: Anything that moves slowly.
A lug nut.
A device for terminating an electrical conductor to facilitate the mechanical connection; to the conductor it may be crimped to form a cold weld, soldered or have pressure from a screw.
A part of something which sticks out, used as a handle or support.
A fool, a large man.
An ear or ear lobe.
definitions.example: While shaving, the poor sod had a fit and cut part of a lug off.

definitions.definition: A wood box used for transporting fruit or vegetables.
A request for money, as for political purposes.
definitions.example: They put the lug on him at the courthouse.

definitions.definition: A rod or pole.
A measure of length equal to 16 1/2 feet.
A lugsail.
(harness) The leather loop or ear by which a shaft is held up.
A loop (or protuberance) found on both arms of a hinge, featuring a hole for the axis of the hinge.
A ridge or other protuberance on the surface of a body to increase traction or provide a hold for holding and moving it.
A lugworm.
(sometimes figurative) To haul or drag along (especially something heavy); to carry; to pull.
definitions.example: Why do you always lug around so many books?

definitions.definition: To run at too slow a speed.
definitions.example: When driving up a hill, choose a lower gear so you don't lug the engine.

definitions.definition: To carry an excessive amount of sail for the conditions prevailing.
To pull toward the inside rail ("lugging in") or the outside rail ("lugging out") during a race.
